author: benharvey.eth
content:
Hey guys! Quick Question. So I believe that when we reached 327,680 active validators the limit for how many validators can be activated per epoch increased from 4 to 5. Does anyone know what the number was prior to this? 

I.e. from 0-327,680 active validators was it always 4 validators activated per epoch, or has it been increasing from say e.g. at 20,000 active validators it was 1 activated per epoch?

If this belongs in any other channel pls lmk

author: djrtwo
content: always 4 until this adjustment

author: benharvey.eth
content: Great, thanks

author: djrtwo
content: see here https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/phase0/beacon-chain.md#get_validator_churn_limit

author: djrtwo
content: `MIN_PER_EPOCH_CHURN_LIMIT == 4` thus it is the minimum no matter the validator count

author: djrtwo
content: then at this threshold it starts scaling upward

author: djrtwo
content: <#598292067260825641> or <#595701173944713277> are probably a more appropriate for this general question
